page.title: 01THE ENVIRONS OF GREAT OFFLEY
page.content: The village of Great Offley lies at the centre of the block assigned to us.It occupies approximately two of the kilometre squares,the remaining squares cover mainly arable land with some grass land. The following pages have information concerning the housing,the life style, the occupations and the social life of the residents.Education,and the role of the village school the church and the religious beliefs of the people are noted.The locally produced village magazine plays an important part in disseminating information. A few historical notes are included to show the changes that have taken place during this century and the effect they have had on the local community.Emma Brown has written about a day in her life which she hopes will give people a picture of life today.
